As it is, I have had occasion to read this book during the course of my studies on the topic touched therein (Allied War Crimes). One might be tempted to sum it up by saying that wars are by nature a dirty thing. Hamburg, Dresden etc... regretably find themselves in the same category as the Wehrmacht`s attacks on Lenin- and Stalingrad. Pointless acts of cruel rage and mindless fury, without even the semblance of a tactical (not to speak of strategical) notion to justify them.
